intro: Cyrtandra bicolor var. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern white-flowered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, two-toned flowers that range from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. It has elliptical to ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This variant is distinguished by its pale floral coloration, which sets it apart from other Cyrtandra species.
